conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas, calculate the work done in each of the three processes: A→B, B→C, and C→A.
Work done by the gas in a process is given by the area under the curve in a P-V diagram.
Process A→B is isochoric with Volume VA = VB = 2 L and Pressure changes from PA = 1 x 10^5 Pa to PB = 4 x 10^5 Pa.
Work done in an isochoric process is zero because W = P ΔV and ΔV = 0. Therefore, WA→B = 0.
Process B→C is isobaric with Pressure PB = PC = 4 x 10^5 Pa and Volume changes from VB = 2 L to VC = 5 L.
Work done in an isobaric process is given by W = P ΔV. Calculate WB→C = PB x (VC - VB).
Process C→A is isochoric with Volume VC = VA = 5 L and Pressure changes from PC = 4 x 10^5 Pa to PA = 1 x 10^5 Pa.
Work done in an isochoric process is zero because W = P ΔV and ΔV = 0. Therefore, WC→A = 0.
Total work done by the gas during the cyclic process is the sum of the work done in each process.
Wtotal = WA→B + WB→C + WC→A = 0 + 1.2 x 10^6 J + 0 = 1.2 x 10^6 J.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings during the cyclic process is 1.2 x 10^6 J.
